website_summaries.verdict: Excellent option for the home chef on a budget who still wants a quality tool. Produces a fine zest.
pros: Sturdy construction makes this a durable kitchen tool
An anti-slip handle makes it easy to hold, and grating or zesting requires very little effort
Dishwasher safe so it's easy to clean
cons: For those without a dishwasher, it's tough to thoroughly hand-wash

customer_reviews.title: Shameless Confession
customer_reviews.text: OK. Shameless confession. I bought this to remove callouses from my heels and feet. It works great. Be careful if you try it. It wasn't made for that purpose. But on really stubborn, thick, hard, cracked, calloused heels like mine, it has worked wonders. Start slow and see how it goes before you get too aggressive with it. If it doesn't work for you, you can always give it to your wife to use in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Leed61

customer_reviews.title: Exactly As Described
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable in the hand for those long grating jobs when you are really too lazy to drag out the food processor. Feels sturdy and steady during use. Easily zests citrus peels, and grates hard cheeses. Also be aware that it will take skin off of your knuckles. Think of it as a handy little kitchen tool with one whole side covered in tiny razor blades. Store appropriately. Oh, and cleans up easily under hot running water, or in the dishwasher. Probably should not be recommended for use by children or novices in the kitchen.

customer_reviews.title: Best zester I've ever had!
